text: Tablet is a conservative online magazine focused on Jewish news and culture. The magazine was founded in 2009 and is supported by the Nextbook foundation. Its editor-in-chief is Alana Newhouse. == History == Tablet was founded in June 2009 by Alana Newhouse, former culture editor at The Forward, with the support of the Nextbook foundation as a redeveloped and news-focused version of the Jewish literary journal Nextbook. In the 3 years after its founding, New York Magazine described Tablet as a "must-read for young politically and culturally engaged Jews. Its reporting has largely focused on Jewish news and culture. === Notable interviews === * Walter Abish * Mike Stoller * Seymour Stein * Naomi Alderman * Shimon Peres * Adina Bar-Shalom == Awards == Tablet has received two National Magazine Awards. The magazine won a Rockower Award in 2013 and another in 2022. == References == Category:Online magazines
title: Tablet (magazine)
